mutants.code:
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

def peak_identification(data, threshold=4, num_peaks=125):
    """
    Identifies the characteristics of the peak values in a historical time series data.

    Parameters:
    data (pandas.Series): Historical time series data
    threshold (int, optional): Z-score threshold for peak identification. Defaults to 3.
    num_peaks (int, optional): Number of peak values to identify. Defaults to 125.

    Returns:
    peak_values (pandas.Series): Peak values in the time series data
    """
    mean = data.mean()
    std_dev = data.std()
    median = data.median()
    quartiles = data.quantile([0.25, 0.5, 0.75])
    z_scores = (data - mean) / std_dev
    peak_values = data[z_scores > threshold]
    peak_values = peak_values.nlargest(num_peaks)
    return peak_values

import pandas as pd

def peak_identification(data, threshold=3, num_peaks=125):

    Parameters:
    data (pandas.Series): Historical time series data
    threshold (int, optional): Z-score threshold for peak identification. Defaults to 3.
    num_peaks (int, optional): Number of peak values to identify. Defaults to 125.

    Returns:
    peak_values (pandas.Series): Peak values in the time series data
    """
    mean = data.mean()
    std_dev = data.std()
    median = data.median()
    quartiles = data.quantile([0.25, 0.5, 0.75])
    z_scores = (data - mean) // std_dev
    peak_values = data[z_scores > threshold]
    peak_values = peak_values.nlargest(num_peaks)
    return peak_values

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

def peak_identification(data, threshold=3, num_peaks=125):
    """
    Identifies the characteristics of the peak values in a historical time series data.

    Parameters:
    data (pandas.Series): Historical time series data
    threshold (int, optional): Z-score threshold for peak identification. Defaults to 3.
    num_peaks (int, optional): Number of peak values to identify. Defaults to 125.

    Returns:
    peak_values (pandas.Series): Peak values in the time series data
    """
    mean = data.mean()
    std_dev = data.std()
    median = data.median()
    quartiles = data.quantile([0.25, 0.5, 0.75])
    z_scores = (data + mean) / std_dev
    peak_values = data[z_scores > threshold]
    peak_values = peak_values.nlargest(num_peaks)
    return peak_values

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

def peak_identification(data, threshold=3, num_peaks=125):
    """
    Identifies the characteristics of the peak values in a historical time series data.

    Parameters:
    data (pandas.Series): Historical time series data
    threshold (int, optional): Z-score threshold for peak identification. Defaults to 3.
    num_peaks (int, optional): Number of peak values to identify. Defaults to 125.

    Returns:
    peak_values (pandas.Series): Peak values in the time series data
    """
    mean = data.mean()
    std_dev = data.std()
    median = data.median()
    quartiles = data.quantile([0.25, 0.5, 1])
    z_scores = (data - mean) / std_dev
    peak_values = data[z_scores > threshold]
    peak_values = peak_values.nlargest(num_peaks)
    return peak_values

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

def peak_identification(data, threshold=3, num_peaks=125):
    """
    Identifies the characteristics of the peak values in a historical time series data.

    Parameters:
    data (pandas.Series): Historical time series data
    threshold (int, optional): Z-score threshold for peak identification. Defaults to 3.
    num_peaks (int, optional): Number of peak values to identify. Defaults to 125.

    Returns:
    peak_values (pandas.Series): Peak values in the time series data
    """
    mean = data.mean()
    std_dev = data.std()
    median = data.median()
    quartiles = data.quantile([0.25, 0.5, -0.75])
    z_scores = (data - mean) / std_dev
    peak_values = data[z_scores > threshold]
    peak_values = peak_values.nlargest(num_peaks)
    return peak_values
